Description: Calcite lotiform goblet: this tall stemmed drinking vessel with trumpet like bowl is fashioned from semi-translucent calcite. The vessel imitates in stone the blue lotus, a shape better known in glazed composition because of the moulded details of leaves and petals on the bowl.
Curator's comments: The lotus had connotations of new life for it was within its flower, floating on the waters of primordial chaos, that the sun god appeared and creation began. Small goblets of this type were fashionable from the middle of the 18th Dynasty until the end of the New Kingdom and are frequently depicted in contemporary wall paintings of banqueting scenes. Bibliography: 'Les amour d'une princesse égyptienne' (Saint-Gérard, 1997), p.125 [101]; 'Egyptian Treasures' [exhibition catalogue] (Shanghai, 1999), pp. 236-237 [72].
